es_first_half: Holmes se había sentado en el sofá y le vi moverse como un hombre que necesita respirar. Una criada se apresuró a abrir la ventana. En el mismo instante le vi levantar la mano y a la señal lancé mi cohete a la habitación con un grito de "¡Fuego!". La palabra no había salido de mi boca cuando toda la multitud de espectadores, tanto los bien vestidos como los mal vestidos, caballeros, posaderos y sirvientas, se unieron en un grito general de "¡Fuego!". Gruesas nubes de humo se extendieron por la habitación
es_second_half: y salieron por la ventana abierta. Alcancé a ver unas figuras que se apresuraban, y un momento después la voz de Holmes desde el interior asegurando que era una falsa alarma. Deslizándome entre la multitud que gritaba, me dirigí a la esquina de la calle, y en diez minutos me alegré de encontrar el brazo de mi amigo entre los míos, y de alejarme de la escena del alboroto. Caminó con rapidez y en silencio durante algunos minutos hasta que doblamos por una de las tranquilas calles que conducen a Edgeware Road.
es_results_raw: por la habitación, y Holmes, con una sonrisa en el rostro, se levantó del sofá y se dirigió hacia la puerta, mientras que yo me apresuraba a seguirle. La criada, que había estado gritando y corriendo de un lado a otro, se detuvo en seco y nos miró con una expresión de sorpresa, como si no entendiera qué estaba sucediendo. La habitación estaba en caos, con gente corriendo en todas direcciones, intentando escapar del humo. Holmes se detuvo en la puerta y se volvió hacia mí, con una mirada seria en el rostro. "¿Qué ha pasado, Holmes?", le pregunté, intentando mantener la calma. "Ha sido un truco", me respondió, con una sonrisa en el rostro. "Un truco para atraer a la atención de la gente y distraerla de lo que realmente importa". Me miró a los ojos y continuó: "Vamos, Watson, tenemos que encontrar la verdad detrás de este misterio". La habitación estaba cada vez más llena de humo, y la gente comenzaba a salir por la ventana. Holmes se dirigió hacia la puerta, y yo le seguí, intentando mantener el ritmo con él. Fuimos hacia el exterior, donde la multitud se había reunido en la calle, gritando y señalando hacia la casa. Holmes se detuvo en la acera y se volvió hacia mí, con una mirada pensativa en el rostro. "¿Qué crees que ha pasado, Watson?", me preguntó. "No lo sé", le respondí, intentando pensar. "Pero creo que vamos a descubrirlo pronto". La multitud comenzaba a dispersarse, y la policía llegaba al lugar. Holmes se dirigió hacia ellos, y yo le seguí, intentando mantener el ritmo con él. La investigación había comenzado, y yo estaba ansioso por descubrir la verdad detrás de este misterio.

It is a delicate balance between vulnerability and reserve, and one that requires a subtle touch to navigate. I would recommend that we proceed with caution, Holmes, and allow her to reveal as much or as little as she desires. Perhaps a gentle inquiry about her well-being, or a sympathetic ear to listen, would be the most effective approach. It was a considerable sum, for people in their position, and the loss of it would have made a serious difference. It was worth an effort to preserve it. The daughter was of a good, amiable disposition, but affectionate and warm-hearted in her ways, so that it was evident that with her fair personal advantages, and her little income, she would not be allowed to remain single long. Now her marriage would mean, of course, the loss of a hundred a year, so what does her stepfather do to prevent it? He takes the obvious course
en_second_half: of keeping her at home and forbidding her to seek the company of people of her own age. But soon he found that that would not answer forever. She became restive, insisted upon her rights, and finally announced her positive intention of going to a certain ball. What does her clever stepfather do then? He conceives an idea more creditable to his head than to his heart. With the connivance and assistance of his wife he disguised himself, covered those keen eyes with tinted glasses, masked the face with a moustache and a pair of bushy whiskers, sunk that clear voice into an insinuating whisper, and doubly secure on account of the girl’s short sight, he appears as Mr. Hosmer Angel, and keeps off other lovers by making love himself.”

The stepdaughter, being a kind and gentle soul, was deeply hurt by her stepfather's words and actions, and she began to feel that she was trapped in a life that was not of her choosing. As the days turned into weeks, and the weeks turned into months, the stepdaughter's unhappiness grew, and she began to feel like she was losing herself in the process of trying to please her stepfather. es_first_half: "Es facil para mi serlo, ya que todos los acontecimientos de aquella espantosa epoca estan grabados en mi memoria. La casa solariega es, como ya he dicho, muy antigua, y sólo un ala está ahora habitada. Las habitaciones de esta ala se encuentran en la planta baja,
es_second_half: mientras que los salones están en el bloque central de los edificios. De estos dormitorios, el primero es el del doctor Roylott, el segundo el de mi hermana y el tercero el mío. No hay comunicación entre ellos, pero todos dan al mismo pasillo. ¿Me explico bien?"
es_results_raw: que son amplias y soleadas, con grandes ventanas que dan a un jardín muy bonito, rodeado de árboles centenarios y un estanque de agua cristalina. Recuerdo que, cuando era niño, solía jugar en ese jardín con mis hermanos, y mi abuela nos contaba historias de la familia que habitó en la casa antes de que nosotros la ocupáramos. Me decía que había sido un lugar de gran felicidad y prosperidad, pero también de gran tragedia y sufrimiento. Me hablaba de la muerte de mi bisabuelo, que había sido un hombre muy querido y respetado en la comunidad, y de la desaparición de mi tía, que había desaparecido misteriosamente cuando era una niña. Me decía que la casa estaba llena de secretos y misterios, y que a veces se escuchaban ruidos extraños y se veían sombras en las ventanas de las habitaciones vacías. Me gustaba escuchar esas historias, pero también me daba miedo, porque sentía que la casa estaba viva y que me estaba contando sus secretos a través de mi abuela.

en_first_half: “Away we went then, and we drove for at least an hour. Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur
en_second_half: of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.

I felt a shiver run down my spine as I gazed out at the passing landscape, and I couldn't help but wonder where we were headed and why. Colonel Stark's silence was starting to unnerve me, and I found myself glancing at him more and more frequently, trying to read his expression. But his face was a mask, his eyes fixed intently on the road ahead. I tried to break the silence by asking him a question, but he didn't seem to hear me, or at least, he didn't respond. The only sound was the creaking of the carriage and the rhythmic thud of the horses' hooves on the rough road. As we drove on, the trees seemed to grow closer together, casting long, ominous shadows across the ground. I felt a sense of unease growing inside me, and I couldn't shake the feeling that we were being watched. The air was heavy with an almost palpable sense of foreboding, and I couldn't help but wonder what lay ahead. Suddenly, the carriage jolted to a stop, and I was thrown forward against the seat in front of me. I looked up to see Colonel Stark standing outside, his face stern and unyielding. He opened the door and motioned for me to get out, his eyes fixed on me with an unnerving intensity. I hesitated for a moment, unsure of what to do, but something in his expression told me that I had no choice. I took a deep breath and stepped out of the carriage, my eyes scanning the surrounding area. We were in a small clearing, surrounded by trees that seemed to loom over us like sentinels. In the center of the clearing stood an old, dilapidated mansion, its windows boarded up and its door hanging crookedly on its hinges. Colonel Stark gestured for me to follow him, and I did so, my heart pounding in my chest. As we approached the mansion, I couldn't help but feel a sense of trepidation. What was going on? Why had Colonel Stark brought me here? And what lay ahead? I pushed open the creaking door and stepped inside, my eyes adjusting slowly to the dim light within. The air inside was musty and stale, and I could hear the faint sound of scurrying rodents coming from the depths of the house. Colonel Stark followed close behind me, his eyes scanning the room with a mixture of curiosity and wariness. I looked around, trying to take in everything at once. The room was large and dimly lit, with cobweb-covered chandeliers hanging from the ceiling and a large stone fireplace at the far end. The walls were adorned with old portraits, their subjects' faces stern and unyielding. I felt a shiver run down my spine as I gazed around the room, my mind racing with questions. What was this place? And what did Colonel Stark want from me? I turned to him, but he was already moving forward, his eyes fixed on something in the corner of the room. I followed him, my heart pounding in my chest. As I approached, I saw that he was staring at a large, ornate mirror that hung on the wall. It was an old-fashioned mirror, with a heavy, ornate frame and a surface that seemed to ripple and distort the light. Colonel Stark's eyes were fixed intently on his own reflection, and I could see a look of deep concentration on his face. I felt a sense of unease growing inside me as I watched him, unsure of what to make of this strange behavior. And then, without warning, he spoke, his voice low and husky. "Look closely," he said, his eyes never leaving his reflection. "Look closely, and you will see the truth." I hesitated for a moment, unsure of what to do. But something in his voice told me that I had to see this through. I leaned forward, my eyes fixed on the mirror, and that was when I saw it. A figure, standing just behind Colonel Stark. A figure that seemed to be watching me, its eyes fixed intently on me. I felt a jolt of fear run through me, and I stumbled backward, my eyes wide with shock. Colonel Stark turned to me, a look of surprise on his face. "What is it?" he asked, his voice low and urgent. I tried to speak, but my voice caught in my throat. Tôi bắt đầu cảm thấy như mình đang bị mắc kẹt trong một thế giới không thực, không biết mình đang đi đến đâu và tại sao lại phải đi. Đại tá Stark vẫn im lặng, không hề nói gì, chỉ có đôi khi giọng nói của ông ta vang lên qua loa đài, nhắc nhở chúng tôi về tốc
es_first_half: "Nos fuimos entonces, y condujimos durante al menos una hora. El coronel Lysander Stark había dicho que sólo eran siete millas, pero yo creía, por la velocidad a la que parecíamos ir, y por el tiempo que tardamos, que debían ser más de doce. Se sentó a mi lado en silencio todo el tiempo, y me di cuenta, más de una vez cuando miré en su dirección, que me estaba mirando con gran intensidad. Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en
es_second_half: cuando me arriesgaba a hacer algún comentario para romper la monotonía del viaje, pero el coronel sólo respondía con monosílabos, y la conversación pronto decaía. Por fin, sin embargo, los golpes de la carretera fueron sustituidos por la crujiente suavidad de un camino de grava, y el carruaje se detuvo. El coronel Lysander Stark se bajó de él y, mientras yo lo seguía, me arrastró a un porche que se abría ante nosotros. Bajamos, por así decirlo, del carruaje y entramos en el vestíbulo, de modo que no pude echar la más fugaz mirada a la fachada de la casa. En el instante en que crucé el umbral, la puerta se cerró de golpe detrás de nosotros, y oí débilmente el traqueteo de las ruedas mientras el carruaje se alejaba."

en_first_half: “It was pitch dark inside the house, and the colonel fumbled about looking for matches and muttering under his breath. Suddenly a door opened at the other end of the passage, and a long, golden bar of light shot out in our direction. It grew broader, and a woman appeared with a lamp in her hand, which she held above her head, pushing her face forward and peering at us. I could see that she was pretty, and from the gloss with which the light shone
en_second_half: upon her dark dress I knew that it was a rich material. She spoke a few words in a foreign tongue in a tone as though asking a question, and when my companion answered in a gruff monosyllable she gave such a start that the lamp nearly fell from her hand. Colonel Stark went up to her, whispered something in her ear, and then, pushing her back into the room from whence she had come, he walked towards me again with the lamp in his hand.
en_results_raw: The light danced across her features, illuminating the delicate curve of her cheekbones and the fullness of her lips. Her eyes, a deep shade of brown that seemed almost black in the dim light, sparkled with a mixture of curiosity and wariness as she took in the sight of us standing there. The colonel, still muttering to himself, stumbled forward, his eyes fixed on the woman, and I could see the faintest glimmer of a smile playing on her lips as she regarded him. She seemed to be sizing us up, trying to determine whether we were friend or foe, and I found myself holding my breath as she took a step closer, the lamp held high above her head, casting eerie shadows on the walls around us. The air was thick with tension, and I could feel the weight of unspoken questions hanging in the air, but the woman's expression remained enigmatic, giving away nothing of her thoughts or intentions. As she drew closer, the light from the lamp danced across the walls, casting a kaleidoscope of shadows that seemed to come alive in the darkness, and I felt a shiver run down my spine as I wondered what secrets this mysterious woman might be hiding.
vi_first_half: Trong nhà tối đen như mực, ông đại tá lần mò tìm diêm và nói thì thầm gì đó. Thình lình một cánh cửa mở ra ở cuối lối đi và một dải ánh sáng dài màu vàng tỏa về phía chúng tôi. Quầng sáng lớn dần lên và một người phụ nữ xuất hiện, giơ một ngọn đèn cao quá đầu. Bà ta ngấng mặt lên và chăm chú nhìn chúng tôi. Tôi có thể thấy rõ là bà ta khá đẹp và qua vẻ bóng mượt của bộ y phục sẫm
vi_second_half: màu được ánh sáng chiếu rọi, tôi biết đó là một loại vải đắt tiền. Bà ta nói vài lời bằng tiếng nước ngoài với ngữ điệu giống như một câu hỏi và khi người đi cùng tôi xẵng giọng trả lời thì bà ta giật mình khiến cho ngọn đèn suýt chút nữa tuột khỏi tay. Đại tá Stark bước đến gần bà ta, thì thào vào tai rồi đẩy bà ta trở lại căn phòng mà bà ta vừa bước ra, sau đó ông ta cầm đèn bước về phía tôi.
es_first_half: "Estaba muy oscuro dentro de la casa, y el coronel buscaba a tientas cerillas y murmuraba en voz baja. De repente se abrió una puerta en el otro extremo del pasillo y una larga barra de luz dorada salió disparada en nuestra dirección. Se ensanchó y apareció una mujer con una lámpara en la mano, que sostenía por encima de la cabeza, adelantando la cara y mirándonos. Pude ver que era guapa, y por el brillo con que la luz iluminaba
es_second_half: su vestido oscuro supe que era de un material rico. Pronunció algunas palabras en una lengua extranjera, en un tono como si estuviera haciendo una pregunta, y cuando mi compañero respondió con un monosílabo ronco, se sobresaltó tanto que la lámpara casi se le cayó de la mano. El coronel Stark se acercó a ella, le susurró algo al oído y luego, empujándola hacia la habitación de la que había salido, volvió a caminar hacia mí con la lámpara en la mano."
es_results_raw: su rostro, su cabello y sus ojos, que brillaban como dos estrellas en la noche, me pareció que era una mujer de una belleza sobrenatural. La luz de la lámpara parecía bailar en sus manos, y su sonrisa era tan cálida y acogedora que me sentí inmediatamente atraído hacia ella. El coronel, sin embargo, parecía estar en una posición más incómoda, y su voz tembló ligeramente cuando habló. "¿Quién eres tú?", preguntó, tratando de mantener la calma. La mujer se acercó un poco más, y su sonrisa se amplió, revelando una fila de dientes blancos y perfectos. "Soy la dueña de esta casa", respondió, su voz melodiosa y suave como la seda. "Y tú, ¿quién eres?" El coronel se aclaró la garganta antes de responder, y su voz sonó un poco más firme. "Soy el coronel...". Pero se detuvo, como si se hubiera dado cuenta de que no sabía cómo continuar. La mujer se rió suavemente, y su risa sonó como música. "No importa", dijo, "no importa quién eres. Lo que importa es que estás aquí, y que estás en mi casa". La luz de la lámpara parecía estar creciendo en intensidad, y me sentí como si estuviera siendo envuelto en una atmósfera de magia y misterio. La mujer se acercó un poco más, y su rostro se encontró a escasos centímetros del mío. "¿Qué te trae aquí?", preguntó, su aliento cálido y fresco en mi cara. Me sentí como si estuviera en un trance, incapaz de responder. Pero entonces, de repente, recordé algo. Algo que me había estado molestando desde que llegamos a la casa. "¿Dónde está...?", pregunté, tratando de mantener la calma. La mujer se detuvo, y su sonrisa se desvaneció. "¿Dónde está quién?", preguntó, su voz un poco más seria. "¿Dónde está mi hermano?", respondí, mi voz temblando ligeramente. La mujer se quedó en silencio durante un momento, y luego asintió con la cabeza. "Sí", dijo, "tu hermano está aquí". Me sentí un alivio inmenso, pero entonces la mujer agregó algo que me hizo sentir un escalofrío en la espalda. "Pero no está solo".

tr_results_raw: onlar, bana karşı son derece nazik ve misafirperver davrandılar. Ancak, evin içinde gizli bir sırrın olduğunu hissediyordum ve bu his, zamanla daha da arttı. Bir gün, Bay Rucastle'ın odasına girdiğimde, bir şeyler bulunduğunu fark ettim. Bir koltukta, bir masada, bir sandalyede, her yerde, sanki bir şeyler saklanmıştı. Bu, bana garip bir his verdi ve ben de, bu gizli sırrı çözmeye karar verdim.

en_first_half: “You will find it rather disconnected, I fear, and there may prove to be little relation between the different incidents of which I speak. On the very first day that I was at the Copper Beeches,
en_second_half: Mr. Rucastle took me to a small outhouse which stands near the kitchen door. As we approached it I heard the sharp rattling of a chain, and the sound as of a large animal moving about.
en_results_raw: but one of the first things that struck me was the peculiar atmosphere of the house itself, which seemed to be a strange mixture of old-world elegance and modern comfort, and the way in which the sunlight streaming through the windows highlighted the intricate patterns of the antique furniture, creating a sense of timelessness that was both captivating and unsettling. The trees surrounding the house, with their gnarled branches and twisted trunks, seemed to lean in, as if they too were trying to listen to the conversations of the inhabitants, and the soft rustling of their leaves in the gentle breeze created a soothing background melody that was both calming and unnerving. It was as if the very essence of the house was a blend of serenity and foreboding, a paradox that I found both intriguing and unnerving, and one that would stay with me long after I left the Copper Beeches.

Cô ấy có vẻ rất thân thiện và đã hỏi tôi về cuộc sống của tôi, nhưng tôi có thể cảm thấy một chút gượng gạo trong cách đối xử của cô ấy. Tôi không biết tại sao, nhưng tôi lại cảm thấy có một chút không thoải mái khi ở trong nhà của họ. Sau khi uống trà, ông Rucastle đã đưa tôi đến phòng ngủ của mình và cho tôi một cái giường để ngủ. Tôi đã cố gắng ngủ nhưng không thể vì tôi quá lo lắng về những gì đã xảy ra. Tôi đã nghe thấy tiếng bước chân nhẹ nhàng của người phụ nữ cao lớn đi qua hành lang và tôi đã thấy ánh sáng từ đèn ngủ của cô ấy chiếu vào phòng của tôi. Tôi đã cố gắng không nhìn vào ánh sáng đó nhưng không thể giúp được. Tôi đã thấy hình ảnh của cô ấy đứng trước cửa phòng của tôi, nhìn vào tôi với một cái nhìn rất kỳ lạ. Tôi đã cảm thấy như thể cô ấy đang cố gắng nói với tôi một điều gì đó nhưng không thể nói được. Tôi đã cố gắng ngủ lại nhưng không thể vì tôi quá lo lắng về những gì đã xảy ra. Tôi đã thức trắng đêm và chờ đợi cho đến sáng sớm hôm sau.
es_first_half: "Me temo que la encontrará bastante inconexa, y puede que haya poca relación entre los distintos incidentes de los que hablo. El primer día que estuve en Copper Beeches, el señor Rucastle me llevó
es_second_half: a una pequeña dependencia que se encuentra cerca de la puerta de la cocina. Cuando nos acercamos a él, oí el agudo traqueteo de una cadena y el sonido de un gran animal moviéndose.
es_results_raw: al jardín, donde me mostró un gran número de plantas exóticas y me explicó que había estado cultivando durante años. Me pareció que estaba muy orgulloso de su trabajo, pero también noté que parecía estar nervioso y alterado, como si estuviera esperando algo. Me pregunté qué podría ser, pero no dije nada, ya que no quería parecer curioso. Al día siguiente, mientras estaba en la cocina, escuché una conversación entre el señor y la señora Rucastle que me hizo sentir incómodo. Estaban hablando en voz baja, pero pude escuchar que decían algo sobre una "cosa" que debían hacer, y que no podían confiar en nadie. Me pregunté qué podía ser, pero no supe qué hacer. La señora Rucastle parecía estar asustada, y el señor Rucastle parecía estar decidido a hacer algo que no quería que nadie supiera. Me sentí como si estuviera en medio de algo que no entendía, y me pregunté si debería hablar con alguien sobre lo que había escuchado. Pero no sabía a quién confiar, y así que decidí seguir investigando por mi cuenta.
tr_first_half: "Korkarım şimdi anlatacaklarımın ilgisiz olduğunu düşüneceksiniz, çünkü bu farklı olayların birbiriyle hiçbir bağlantısı yokmuş gibi görünüyor: Akgürgenler Konağına ilk geldiğimde, Bay
tr_second_half: Rucastle beni mutfak kapısından girilebilen küçük bir ek binaya götürmüştü. Oraya yaklaştığımızda zincir şangırtıları ve büyük bir hayvanın kıpırdanışını andıran sesler duydum.
tr_results_raw: Smith'in bana gösterdiği o eski, karanlık odada, bir zamanlar bir cinayetin işlendiğini hissediyordum. Odayı terk ettiğimde, bir sokakta rastladığım bir kadının bana bir parça kumaş verdiğini hatırlıyorum. Kumaşın üzerinde, bir isim yazılıydı: "Evelyn". O zamanlar ne anlama geldiğini bilmiyordum, ancak şimdi anlıyorum ki, o isim bana bir başka olayı hatırlatıyordu: Bay Smith'in bana anlattığı, bir kadının bir gece, Akgürgenler Konağı'nın bahçesinde, bir ağaç altında ölü olarak bulunmuş olması. O kadının adı da Evelyn'di. Bu olayın Bay Smith'in bana anlattığı olayla ne ilgisi olduğunu bilmiyordum, ancak şimdi anlıyorum ki, her iki olay da, Akgürgenler Konağı'nın gizemli geçmişine dair ipuçlarıydı.
